snippet: Defense officials said that American airstrikes and Kurdish fighters had broken the Islamic militants’ siege of Mount Sinjar, allowing thousands of the Yazidis trapped there to escape.
abstract: Defense Department officials report that United States airstrikes and Kurdish fighters in Iraq have broken Islamic militants' siege of Mount Sinjar, allowing thousands of Yazidis trapped there to escape; Yazidis are religious minority who are regarded as apostates by Islamic State in Iraq and Syria militants, and are being targeted for death.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Washington, and Michael D. Shear from Edgartown, Mass. Reporting was contributed by Suzanne Daley and Scott Sayare from Paris, Alan Cowell from London, and Alison Smale from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Defense officials said that American airstrikes and Kurdish fighters had broken the Islamic militants’ siege of Mount Sinjar, allowing thousands of the Yazidis trapped there to escape.

headline.main: Militants’ Siege on Mountain in Iraq Is Over, Pentagon Says
